intro: Seseli tortuosum subsp. thracicum, commonly known as the Thrace bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
